ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, it was a great course covering a wide amount of Colonial American History. As someone with little prior knowledge of the region in this period, I learnt a great deal from this course.

Dean Farley is a very intelligent and interesting discussion leader, but the class itself could use some improvement. Colonial American History can be pretty boring, and the course's arrangement doesn't help much - you basically cycle through the different regions of the colonies every three weeks. The readings are generally good, but there is a LOT of reading. Not only that, but it is often not exactly clear what you are expected to know for class. There were weeks where I spent hours reading a book, only to either just graze on it during class or even skip it entirely. Other weeks, books were assigned that were not readily available, leading to a scramble around the different libraries and bookstores for obscure books. Make sure you plan ahead and get the books early if you plan on taking the course - not all of them will be there when you buy your reading list. There is a lot of primary source work, but a lot of it is very dull. Dean Farley is what you would expect from a dean - fair, but strict. He has that additional obligation, so keep in mind that his primary role is as dean and not as a professor.

I highly recommend History 124J. The course gave me a completely new understanding of Colonial American History. It is heavily reading intensive, and requires a substantial amount of individual research, but Dean Farley is a great prof on the subject, and I would recommend it to any history major.
